intro: Leucas helferi, commonly known as the narrow-leaved leucas, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, clustered in umbels, and bloom during the warmer months. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest floors or along stream banks.
